intro: Solanum egranulatum, commonly known as the white nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant features hairy, alternate leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are typically berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Solanum egranulatum is often found in moist, shady environments and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
